message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the total variation distance between two LMCs, which is a concept that is relevant to several areas of computer science. The use of LMCs is common in probabilistic verification, speech recognition, and computational biology, which suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of cs.IT, cs.DS, and cs.LG. The algorithmic aspects of the paper, including the polynomial-time algorithm and the NP-hardness result, suggest that it could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.DM and cs.CC.
